website_summaries.verdict: The simple design of this VR headset allows users to quickly set up and dive in without the need for a base station.
pros: Features high-resolution and a brisk refresh rate
You can stream your favorite games directly from content stores
Flip-up visor let's you jump back to reality in a flash if need be
cons: Tracking on this model isn't as precise as other VR headsets, but updates have made it more reliable

customer_reviews.title: Was great while it worked.
customer_reviews.text: It worked straight away and was great. But now it won't turn on reliably and keeps popping up with an error that I have corrected multiple times. I feel like it's supposed to be an easy setup but I've been here hours now. I realize it was only just released so software updates could fix some issues, but it's very annoying that I now basically can't use it despite doing everything right (as far as I can tell). If I was you I'd wait and check the reviews a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Maddock

customer_reviews.title: Can't be used in a dark room, WTF?!?!?!?
customer_reviews.text: WTF? I need to have ALL THE FREAKING LIGHTS TURNED ON FOR THIS TO WORK?!?!?!?!? Sorry - but VR is best enjoyed in a darkened room, NOT IN A FULLY LIT ONE!!! This got sent straight back as soon as I realized just how severely limited the device is
customer_reviews.author: Voyd_Indigo

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, but where are the games?
customer_reviews.text: As far as modern VR headsets go, this is absolutely the best available. But HTC seem to be having some kind of holy war with Steam about game content, and as a result, none of the big game titles support this headset even if they claim to support HTC Vive. e.g. Fallout 4, Skyrim, Subnautica, Batman, etc, etc. Without the games to play, it's basically a very expensive brick.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Halliday

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price currently
customer_reviews.text: Pros: High screen resolution Comfortable Good audio Cons: Expensive Software clunky Pairing controllers can be difficult Controllers run on AA batteries Controller tracking issues (Major flaws) For the price I expected far better, either save some money and go for the Rift S or spend a (relatively) small amount more and go for the Valve Index (which I did after returning this one for a refund)
customer_reviews.author: David P

customer_reviews.title: Oh My!
customer_reviews.text: A whole new experience in gaming. Can be used for other applications but excels in games that support VR. Pretty comfortable, up to about three hours without discomfort. One star removed for the way the headphones are adjusted, irritating at best.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible with many USB 3.0 manufacturers
customer_reviews.text: The future is dull and irritating. Universal Serial Bus Ports (USB) aren't as universal. 2 different providers on my computer don't work with this headset, I ended up buying another USB card which was supposed to work but it also did not. When you have so many problems at the start, who knows how many await in the future. Pass.
customer_reviews.author: KG&S

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage - worse than the oculus rift original by about 100%
customer_reviews.text: The FoV on this product is ridiculous, you won't feel immersed or as though you are even in VR. The sweet spot is so tight that actually getting a clear image in the headset is also practically impossible without constantly fidgeting with it. The worst thing? The sensors don't work properly, even in high light environments it states you need to turn up the lights. Sent back immediately, expecting a full refund. IF Vive had any conscience, they would pull this broken product. Also note i'm writing this in October 2020.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Better than what I expecting !
customer_reviews.text: my cosmos arrived yesterday and Im pretty impressed so far. Amazing graphics and sense of immersion and really like the flip feature !
customer_reviews.author: Sai Yone

customer_reviews.title: It's a good headset
customer_reviews.text: What I liked was the display quality images sharp clear easy to read text. Headset is comfortable. I don't like the price. I don't like the controller tracking, However its not as bad as other reviews say just make sure you update firmware it does improve it. I like that the headset is upgradeable to elite version should you wish at a later point.
customer_reviews.author: MrM

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t even work in a well lit room, too many wires compared to the oculus rift s and it’s blurry inside. 5 of my friends tried this and all said they came away feeling sick after playing for 5 minutes. Wouldn’t accept this headset if it was given to me for free.
customer_reviews.author: Kierran Wiber

customer_reviews.title: Anyone who gave it 5 stars is lying to you. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst headset on teh market. Only after you buy it do they suggest you have patterned wallpaper to help with tracking. you'll also need your play space to be lit close to teh surface of teh sun for it to work at night. The software is lame, i returned it. Whoever gave this a 5 star rating is lying or didn't use it for very long. The controller sensors perform worse that the Rift S did on launch. For the price you'd expect it to work better.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. Da Silva

customer_reviews.title: Worst headset ever made. Period!
customer_reviews.text: The headset is atrocious out of the box. Tracking is such an abomination.
customer_reviews.author: Adel

customer_reviews.title: Not sure where this fits
customer_reviews.text: Well i tried one for a while its nothing special although you'd expect it to be, like all Vive VR it boils down to the price. For me the Rift S fits that bill not very much difference in performance. Save yourself a few hundred pounds and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good headset, built-in sound system
customer_reviews.text: Very good option, especially when on deal. Works very well with the Vive Port subscription which gives access to numerous games I wouldn't have tried otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Ju

product_meta.title: HTC VIVE Cosmos VR Headset with in built tracking and flip up design
product_meta.description: Vive Cosmos. REFINED INSIDE OUT TRACKING-Expand your range of motion with six camera sensors. Accurate inside-out tracking via wide field of view (FOV) and six degree-of-freedom (6DoF) support. Immersive VR right out of the box. QUICK AND EASY SET UP-Inside-out tracking enables plug-and-play portability. Pairs with a wide array of VR-ready PC and laptops. No base stations needed. CRYSTAL CLEAR GRAPHICS-View texts and graphics through a 2880 x 1700 combined pixel resolution—an 88% increase over the original VIVE. All-new LCD panels reduce the distance between pixels, minimizing the screen-door effect. 2880 x 1700 combined resolution;Real RGB displays;Minimal screen door effect. FLIP UP DESIGN-Jump between reality and virtual reality in seconds with the innovative flip-up design—all without disrupting your immersive journey. Customizable fit. Features soft, lightweight, and easy-to-clean materials for all-day play. IPD (interpupillary distance) adjustment takes into account the distance between your pupils for a comfortable viewing experience. Suitable for a wide range of face shapes and vision types, as well as users with glasses. RICH AND VIBRANT SOUND-High-quality audio integrated into on-ear, form-fitting headphones. Experience great sound and comfort during extended VR adventures. ALL NEW CONTROLS-Style meets utility. Glows during active use. Emitted light ensures accurate tracking on controllers. Get an edge with precision joysticks. VR-FUTURE PROOFED-Expand with the virtual universe. Discover the world's first VR system with a suite of modular options. Go beyond what you thought possible. This is only the beginning.
